intro: Erysimum barbarea var. patens, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, four-petaled flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in rocky or disturbed areas and is known for its ability to thrive in coastal environments. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly used in gardens and landscaping.
